file_content.text: We've been awaiting your return. Please, step forward.
You have saved untold lives, through your defeat of Lord Vivicar and the destruction of the plague.
Thanks to you, the shadow of the plague has been lifted from the order.
There's a title reserved for the most prestigious among us, whose wisdom and skill safeguard the galaxy. It hasn't been bestowed in thousands of years.
There were... objections, given your methods. But we must acknowledge the debt we owe. Therefore, we name you Barsen'thor, Warden of the Order.
But you have proved worthy. Now the Council names you Barsen'thor, Warden of the Order.
How many Jedi have been named Barsen'thor?
Have there been many?
In all our millennia of history, you will be the third to carry the title.
I will do all I can to live up to this honor.
I hope I'm deserving.
I never imagined your potential would take you so far.
Your actions leave me in no doubt.
That's... nice.
No, no, there is no need. You have earned this honor.
And not a moment too soon. We have need of you.
We have received word that the Republic is facing a new threat.
I stand ready for anything, Master.
I'm prepared.
Well, I am the best.
A real challenge.
We need time to prepare a war council. The Supreme Chancellor himself will be attending.
Take time to rest. And, you should record your journey in the Jedi Archives. History must know of your actions.
Return to us, when you feel ready. For now, the entire order will know there is a new Barsen'thor among us.
Scorekeeper smiles, Herald. Is great honor your people give you. Points beyond measure!
We hunt side by side, Qyzen. Whatever my score, you share it.
Half of them are yours.
Is... is noble thing you say. You are Herald, and you are true Jedi.
It's a big galaxy. Think how many points are waiting to be claimed.
Still more to go.
Yes. Score can always be greater. So it shall be.
Honors are nice, but I'd like something I can spend.
I'd prefer credits.
Scorekeeper gives to those who seek, Herald. Galaxy awaits.
Nothing like a well-deserved reward, eh, Jedi? It's no luxury cruise to Corellia, but still, that's quite the title you have.
I feel like I should curtsy.
There's still plenty of work for us, and I need your help. Are you in?
We're not done yet.
Please, Jedi. Doctor Tharan Cedrax never leaves a project unfinished.
Don't hold back on my account, Holiday.
What's stopping you?
And I thought it was just men who needed their egos massaged.
In this outfit? You wish.
I think we've earned ourselves a little time to relax.
Let's have some fun.
In your dulcet tones, that sounds even sweeter.
I didn't think a Jedi could say that with a straight face.
Well, without Vivicar's minions hounding us, the galaxy is vast and wide. Shall we?
We felt it! A massive shift in the Force.
I'm so sorry. The Masters you saved... their condition deteriorated suddenly. We have lost them to the plague.
We have reports from across the galaxy--dozens of Masters have died from the plague, maybe hundreds.
The plague is gone, and so is the true plaguemaster: Terrak Morrhage.
But it's finally over.
Their deaths were the price of Terrak Morrhage's destruction.
They died to stop this evil.
If Terrak Morrhage's plan had succeeded, the entire order could have been wiped out.
We got off lightly.
Morrhage? So this threat was even greater than we knew.
The Masters you saved have reported a sudden improvement in their condition. The plague is over, thanks to you.
Jedi across the galaxy are reporting an improvement in their condition. The plague is over, thanks to you.
And... I sense Parkanas Tark. For the first time in many years. How can that be?
Lord Vivicar--Parkanas--has been freed from darkness.
Vivicar was saved.
I wouldn't have dreamed it possible. Perhaps there's hope for him.
When he comes back to Tython, he can answer all your questions.
Ask him yourself.
I saved him for your judgment.
Death was too easy.
Truth is, when it comes to Parkanas, it is we who should be judged.
We persuaded the Republic to divert a starship to your location, just in case. The crew can bring Vivicar back to us.
Thank you for all you have done. The Jedi Order owes its survival to you.
Please, return to us on Tython. We wish to thank you in person, and we have a special reward for you.
Find Vivicar before it's too late!
Go to the coordinates quickly, before Vivicar strikes back. And, Jedi--may the Force be with you.
The ritual was a success. Lord Vivicar is out in uncharted space, but he knows I'm coming.
Now only your shielding talent can stop him.
You've shown great fortitude and saved your Master despite the odds.
But Lord Vivicar will have made preparations, and he still has his greatest weapon--the plague.
Now that I know who he really is, I could return Vivicar to the light.
Perhaps I can save him.
A noble thought but don't take unnecessary risks. Your shielding ability is our only hope.
With his location revealed, Vivicar may choose to simply unleash the plague on us.
He's cornered and dangerous.
If that happens, your shielding ability will be our only protection. You must survive.
If that's his best weapon, he'll get a shock if he tries to use it on me.
He'll still die.
When darkness overcame Yuon, you had the will to do what was necessary.
Lord Vivicar will have made preparations, and he still has his greatest weapon--the plague.
We've been monitoring events in the meditation chamber. Please return to the Council at once.
Watch over Master Yuon.
You summoned me, Master Syo.
Welcome home.
I wish we could greet you with better news.
Despite using every avenue available to us, we're no closer to finding Lord Vivicar.
Actually, I believe we are. A common thread binds all the plague victims: the loss of Parkanas Tark at Malachor Three.
Vivicar's influence forced the sick Masters to relive their failures on Malachor. This is revenge, personal revenge.
Only one man would have that much anger and pain. The man who was left behind. I believe Lord Vivicar is Parkanas Tark.
Jedi, Parkanas is dead.
Far from it, Jaric.
Yuon? I told those Padawans to keep an eye on you. You must rest!
No. My pupil--my fellow Jedi--deserves to hear the truth about Malachor.
You're ill, Master Yuon. Don't speak more than you have to.
Master, don't strain yourself.
Then tell us, Master Yuon.
Please do.
What have you been hiding?
I knew it.
Malachor Three isn't just strong in the dark side; the planet is the resting place of the Sith Lord Terrak Morrhage.
Our work on Malachor woke Morrhage's spirit. One by one, we fell under his power. The things we did... still haunt me.
The Noetikons on Coruscant said that Terrak Morrhage originally created the plague.
Morrhage? I know that name.
Then I've been punished appropriately. We paid a terrible price to break free of him.
Somehow you got free of Morrhage's power.
But you escaped.
Yes. Together, we managed to break his control, but at a terrible cost.
What happened to Parkanas Tark?
Just focus on Parkanas.
Parkanas was the youngest, and weakest. We had to abandon him to Malachor's darkness. His sacrifice allowed the rest of us to escape.
But it seems he survived and has taken Morrhage's dark path.
You couldn't have predicted this.
It's not your fault.
You knew Vivicar when he was Parkanas Tark. How can I stop him?
Help me end this.
Why did you keep this a secret?
You should have told me!
I wasn't eager to tell my greatest student about my worst failure.
I must make amends. I have a plan to help you find Vivicar.
If the plague created a link between my mind and his, your shielding ability may allow me to use that link to find him.
No. You're already weak from the plague, Yuon. This could kill you.
Vivicar won't get the chance. I'll be between him and my Master.
I'll protect Yuon.
It's our best chance to find Vivicar.
Master Yuon knows what she's doing.
It's her decision.
I have meditated on this. Any other avenue would take too long.
We're out of options.
She's right. We must prevent this plague spreading further.
He's right. We must prevent this plague spreading further.
Yuon is fearless and wise--a true hunter, like Herald.
Do all female Jedi have the same durasteel backbone?
Rather intrepid, isn't she? It's quite fetching.
Very well, Yuon. But we will monitor the ritual, and your former Padawan must stay at your side.
Thank you, Syo.
I will go to the meditation chamber to prepare. Please meet me there when you are ready.
Master Sidonie just checked in. She seems well, but very frustrated with herself.
She reports that you were able to prevent war from breaking out on Alderaan, however.
She reports you were unable to prevent war, but that you stopped her before things became irreparable. Alderaan will eventually find peace.
You've once again done very good work in a tense situation, Jedi.
I did my best, given the situation.
It was hard, but I managed.
The Council has come to expect nothing less of you.
I relied on the teachings of the Jedi.
The Force was with me.
A mark of a true Jedi--being able to trust in the Force in all circumstances.
Master Sidonie certainly didn't make it easy.
In spite of Master Sidonie.
This plague has such a devastating effect on even the most capable Jedi.
Tell me, did you learn anything new about the plaguemaster, Lord Vivicar?
I wish I could say I had.
I'm sorry.
Master Sidonie mentioned him, but she had no information.
Nothing at all.
She told me he was in her head, influencing her actions.
He was affecting Sidonie.
I see. Master Sidonie was the last of the lost Masters, and yet Vivicar still eludes us.
Return to us here on Tython immediately, and we will discuss what you have learned. Lord Vivicar cannot remain hidden forever.
The Council will continue its research. Thank you for your hard work.
But you must investigate Tatooine. Until we learn who Vivicar is, our best defense is to free the Jedi Masters he controls.
Hallam Organa told me what happened at the summit. I'm sorry that Master Sidonie is dead.
I wish it hadn't turned out this way.
I'm sorry....
I was afraid it would come to this.
She was inciting a war. She drew her lightsaber and wouldn't back down.
There was nothing I could do.
Then you did what you thought was necessary to maintain peace on Alderaan.
She begged for death, and I gave it to her.
She wanted it this way.
I see. So Master Sidonie lost hope in the end.
I wish it had ended differently, but I'm sure you did what you felt was right.
But Hallam also reports that you prevented Sidonie from inflaming the war on Alderaan. Commendable work.
Hallam also reports that while you were unable to prevent a war, you stopped Sidonie before the damage became irreparable. Commendable work, Jedi.
Master Eriz has reported back to the Council--good work.
He speaks of discoveries on Tatooine. We intend to hear his full report when he returns to Coruscant.
Did you discover anything more about the plaguemaster--this Lord Vivicar?
How is the search for Master Eriz? It's imperative that you find him and sever the connection to Lord Vivicar.
The connection is severed, but unfortunately, Master Eriz could not be spared.
I couldn't save him.
Master Eriz has been permanently taken care of.
Eriz is dead.
Master Eriz's reason was broken. I had to kill him.
He was insane and had to die.
I'm truly sorry to hear that.
Master Eriz was a credit to the Jedi Order.
Before he died, were you able to learn anything more about this plaguemaster, Lord Vivicar?
Only what I already knew--that he somehow controls the Masters' minds.
Not really.
Master Eriz seemed to think Vivicar was why he kept remembering Malachor Three and his friend Parkanas.
Eriz had a theory.
A connection between the events on Malachor Three and our current circumstances is clearly forming.
He was as useless as the others.
Nothing. It was a total waste.
A shame. If we could find Vivicar, we could end this plague.
But we have accounted for all our missing Masters, and the plaguemaster is still at large.
We must discuss your findings in person. Return to us on Tython immediately. We may yet find a way to locate Lord Vivicar.
The Council will continue its own investigation into the matter.
Meanwhile, hurry to Alderaan. So long as Lord Vivicar has control of even one Master, he will grow in power.
Of course.
I will stop him.
Yes, Master Syo.
Good. Do not delay. Every wasted moment works in Lord Vivicar's favor.
I've just received Bela Whinn's report. I'm sorry we lost Laranna Fain, but I'm sure you did what you could.
My poor Laranna. There... "there is no death," there can't be....
I've just received Bela Whinn's report. I'm so glad Laranna Fain is shielded and well.
Thank you for my daughter's life. I have to go to her.
Did you manage to learn anything more about Lord Vivicar, the plaguemaster?
He claimed that he was once a member of our order....
He was once a Jedi....
He needs to touch his victims in order to spread the plague....
I spoke to him personally....
He just babbled on about how he'd already won....
He's very arrogant.
I'm listening....
So this scarred man, who healed Laranna Fain, is Lord Vivicar. Amazing work, Jedi.
Still no leads on how to find him, but we do know more about his plague.
Hopefully we can put that information to good use.
I did my best.
Unfortunately, we now have the chance.
So what do we do?
I wish I had better news, but the situation has worsened.
I needed to find out more.
It's not enough.
You saved the ship, and we learned a great deal... just in time.
Two more Jedi Masters have now gone silent. In their last transmissions, both Masters said "the darkness is coming."
One Master was on Alderaan, the second on Tatooine. You must go to these worlds and investigate, quickly.
It may be a false alarm.
You're sure they're connected?
I hope so. However, both Masters were friends with Cin Tykan and Duras Fain.
I will aid these Masters.
Thank you, I know you will.
The plaguemaster will suffer for this.
Vivicar will pay.
Revenge is not our way... but Vivicar has to be stopped at any cost.
May the Force be with you on Tatooine and Alderaan. Good luck.
We received a distress signal from the Republic starship Carida, and we suspect it's plague-related.
Relay me the pertinent details.
What's happened?
The distress call only reported a Jedi had gone insane and turned on the crew.
Is there a Jedi Master on board?
Another Master?
No, not a Master, a Jedi passenger. She has lost her mind and killed several people.
What makes you think that?
The distress signal reported a Jedi gone mad, killing people aboard, talking about darkness. The symptoms match.
Of particular interest--the Jedi in question is Laranna Fain, Master Duras Fain's daughter.
It seems mental dysfunction runs in the family. I hope she hasn't started a cult.
Enough, Tharan! If I wasn't already en route to Tython, I'd go to the ship myself. My poor Laranna.
Fain is on his way back to Tython, but I've asked him to join us over holo; I thought he should be kept informed.
I should hope so, Syo! Being a Jedi doesn't stop me from caring about my own daughter!
After what happened to Fain, take care in dealing with his daughter.
Do you think the plague is spread through families?
Is the plague genetic?
No, but this can't be a coincidence, either. Vivicar chooses his targets for a reason.
I may gain insight into this plague from Laranna.
We could learn much from her.
Any discovery about Vivicar or how the plague is spread could be vital.
I'll investigate.
You will dock in the ship's forward section, where Lieutenant Bela Whinn and her men have managed to find safety.
Find Laranna Fain, shield her if you can, and see what you can learn. Go with care.
Congratulations for your hard work on Taris. This must have been difficult for you.
Master Tykan has already contacted me. A team is on its way to bring him before the Republic courts.
Master Tykan deserves an advocate. None of this was his fault.
Someone should speak for him.
True, but unfortunately we cannot let word of the plague become public.
I can't imagine a punishment worse than what Master Tykan's endured already.
He's suffered enough.
Neither can I. Still, the Republic must seek justice for the deaths on Taris.
I'm sure the Republic has a deep, dark cell they can spare for him.
He doesn't deserve mercy.
Cin Tykan remains a Jedi Master, and he will be treated with the respect due his rank.
Master Tykan asked me to pass on his gratitude. We all appreciate the sacrifice your shielding technique requires.
You've endured much on Taris, but I have an urgent matter that requires your attention.
The rumors of Lord Vivicar on Ord Mantell remain our best chance of finding him. No more people should suffer as Cin Tykan has.
Still, for such a notable Jedi to fall so far, plague or not....
Master Tykan was being compelled by someone he called "Lord Vivicar."
He said he was under orders.
Before he was healed, Master Tykan spoke of a "Lord Vivicar."
Tykan gave me a name.
Tykan was raving about a "Lord Vivicar." Does that mean anything to you?
Forget that, I have a lead.
Lord Vivicar. I don't recognize the name. We must begin researching this at once.
Unfortunately our master on Nar Shaddaa is still missing. If "Lord Vivicar" is responsible, you may be our only hope.
Master Tykan's loss is a tragedy, not only to the order but to the Tarisian restoration effort.
Hopefully the work on Taris can continue without him.
I'm sorry to hear that.
Undoubtedly it will, but Master Tykan was irreplaceable.
It was too risky. He might have turned on the Republic again.
I was protecting everyone.
Then perhaps it's for the best. Republic civilians rely on the order's protection, especially now.
I stopped a fallen Jedi from wreaking havoc. There's nothing tragic about that.
It wasn't a tragedy.
A quick lightsaber must be guided by great compassion, Jedi. Don't forget.
At least now Taris is safe. I only hope Master Tykan's work does not go unfinished.
This plague is relentless. Our most gifted Masters suffer, and you are our sole defense against it.
Before he died, Master Tykan spoke of a "Lord Vivicar."
Tykan mentioned a name.
Master Tykan's attacks on the Republic were on the command of a "Lord Vivicar."
He was under orders.
Before he died, Tykan gave up a name: "Lord Vivicar."
I managed to get a lead.
I've heard a report from Nar Shaddaa. The Guiding Hand has disbanded, and the Hutt Cartel has withdrawn its vendetta.
I was disturbed to hear you gave Fain to the Cartel. Please explain why.
The Cartel wouldn't have been satisfied with anything less.
He was a necessary sacrifice.
You're probably right.
It was Fain or the Republic's future.
I did it for the Republic.
You made a difficult decision. I hope you can live with it.
He caused chaos and then tried to kill me. Fain deserved it.
Fain had it coming.
When a Jedi falls, we fight to save him, not abandon him.
At least the Hutt Cartel is appeased, despite the terrible cost.
Your handling of the Cartel was extremely impressive. Diplomatic skill under pressure is a rare gift.
Now perhaps Duras Fain can be rehabilitated.
Maybe Master Fain will be wiser after this.
I hope so.
He often shrugs off the lessons life gives him. With luck, this one will stick.
Master Fain seems quite set in his ways.
Fain's too stubborn.
True. He has changed little since he was a Padawan.
Fain's unconventional but gifted. Don't force him to be something he's not.
Respect his abilities.
I suppose great talent often comes with great flaws.
I'm glad your mission on Nar Shaddaa was a success, but now I have an urgent matter that requires your attention.
The rumor of Lord Vivicar on Ord Mantell is still our best lead. You should investigate with all haste. Good luck.
Our research into the plague has made little progress. Did you learn anything about this plaguemaster?
Do you know of a "Lord Vivicar"?
I have a name.
Fain's torment was caused by someone called "Lord Vivicar."
Possibly.
Fain was raving about a "Lord Vivicar."
Not much of a lead.
"Lord Vivicar". I have never heard the name. The Council will investigate this at once.
Meanwhile, I'm afraid our master on Taris is still missing. If this "Vivicar" is responsible, you may be his only chance.
But I regret Fain's loss. What could he have become, with the right guidance?
Mourning the past distracts us from the future.
"What-ifs" help nobody.
A sad outcome.
Fain was dangerous enough already.
Maybe a greater menace.
I will learn from this. I will not fail a fellow Jedi again.
It's good to hear from you. The Council was starting to get concerned.
Were you able to learn anything of Lord Vivicar's operations?
Vivicar's apprentice had hoped to kill me in order to please his master....
It was a trap.
Lord Vivicar was never on Ord Mantell....
Nothing useful.
Only that Lord Vivicar has an apprentice....
I met his apprentice.
Only that Lord Vivicar used to have an apprentice....
I killed his apprentice.
I'm listening....
Kellian Zell, hm? The Council will investigate this man. Perhaps he will lead us to Vivicar.
Meanwhile, we can be certain that you now have Vivicar's attention.
I won't let him catch me unaware.
I'll be cautious.
You have scored a victory against him. No doubt he'll be more vigilant next time.
Hopefully this will draw him out of whatever hole he's hiding in.
Good. He might show his face.
But for now, his true location is still a mystery to us.
I can handle him.
Many Jedi have died, overestimating their powers.
You must press on. Our Master on Nar Shaddaa is still missing--if Vivicar's plague is responsible, you are his only chance.
You must push on. Our Master on Taris is still missing--if Vivicar's plague is responsible, you are his only chance.
I realize your ordeal with Zell must have shaken you, but I have important news concerning your mission.
As part of our research into the plague, we've asked our sources to pay closer attention to Sith movements.
A Sith named "Lord Vivicar" arrived on Ord Mantell shortly before our informant there disappeared.
What would Lord Vivicar be doing on Ord Mantell?
Why would he be there?
I don't know, but the plague could do untold damage there. We must find him!
I will go to Ord Mantell and investigate immediately.
I'm on my way.
Be careful. Ord Mantell is a war-torn planet. I'm sending you Lord Vivicar's last known location, but we never got a description of this Sith.
Can we believe the reports?
Our informant walked through fire to smuggle out this information. He must have believed it was accurate.
Unfortunately, the report cut off before we got a description of Lord Vivicar.
Go to Ord Mantell. If Vivicar is there, he must be stopped!
I'll handle Vivicar in short order, Master Syo.
I will do so.
The plaguemaster has been careful not to reveal himself. I might be walking into a trap.
This is suspicious.
But if the reports are true, innocent people are in danger. We can't risk ignoring this.
I have missing Jedi to find. Must I waste my time chasing rumors?
Why must it be me?
If Vivicar is on Ord Mantell, your shielding technique may be our only hope.
I'm sending Lord Vivicar's last known location to you now. Be on your guard. If he caught our informant, Vivicar may know you are coming.
May the Force be with you.
